articles.title: Are Netflix’s Lofty Ambitions Grounded in Reality?
articles.content: Netflix aims to reach a $1 trillion market cap by 2030 through subscriber growth, ad revenue, and global expansion. The company's strong financials and strategic initiatives suggest this goal is attainable, though challenges like economic conditions and competition remain.

articles.title: This Volatile Market Is Made for Nickel-and-Diming These Names
articles.content: The article discusses how investors can take advantage of the current volatile market by studying the daily price movements and volatility of stocks like NVIDIA, Apple, and Netflix. It provides statistical insights on the average daily price changes and deviations for these stocks, which can help investors strategize and trade effectively during uncertain times.

articles.title: Apple fans spent $1,199 on an iPhone — Bitcoin buyers turned it into a MacBook
articles.content: If you purchased Bitcoin instead of Apple's iconic iPhone 16 Pro Max on its launch day, you would be able to purchase a MacBook Pro with M4 chip today.

articles.title: Survey Shows Pent-Up Demand For New Apple iPhones
articles.content: A survey of U.S. consumers in March indicates surprisingly strong demand for iPhone upgrades despite "a challenging fundamental backdrop."

articles.title: Apple Rebuilds Siri Team With Vision Pro Veterans After Project Setbacks
articles.content: Apple brings in new faces from Vision Pro team to reboot Siri, following project delays and mounting competitive pressure

articles.title: Bessent Calls U.S.-China Trade War Unsustainable; S&P 500 Bounces
articles.content: The U.S.-China standoff over tariffs is unsustainable and likely to de-escalate, Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent said.

articles.title: Tech Rallies as Traders Rotate Back Into Hard-Hit Sector -- Tech Roundup
articles.content: Shares of technology companies rallied, as traders rotated back into a sector seen as particularly sensitive to the U.S.-Chinese trade war. Nvidia, the artificial-intelligence enabling chip maker...

articles.title: Trade deals are key to halting US tech decline, Wedbush’s Ives says
articles.content: Investing.com -- Wedbush tech analyst Dan Ives highlighted the urgent need for trade deals to address the challenges facing the US technology sector amid ongoing tariff disputes. The analysts pointed out the significant uncertainty and potential damage to the US and global economies, particularly the US tech industry, which has been thrust into the eye of the storm.
